results.title: The Piano
results.overview: After a long voyage from Scotland, pianist Ada McGrath and her young daughter, Flora, are left with all their belongings, including a piano, on a New Zealand beach. Ada, who has been mute since childhood, has been sold into marriage to a local man named Alisdair Stewart. Making little attempt to warm up to Alisdair, Ada soon becomes intrigued by his Maori-friendly acquaintance, George Baines, leading to tense, life-altering conflicts.

results.title: Grand Piano
results.overview: Moments before his comeback performance, a concert pianist who suffers from stage fright discovers a note written on his music sheet.

results.title: Piano
results.overview: Marta hauls a piano home from a used music shop. She almost succeeds. Albert tries for the thirtieth year already to tell Paula that he loves her. He almost succeeds. Paula wants to respond to Albert in the same vein. She almost succeeds. Police commissioner Kits has dreamed of parachuting all his life. He almost succeeds. Mirjam wants be become a circus artist. She almost succeeds. A honeybee tries to get out past a closed window. It almost succeeds. A film without main characters where the lives of characters that have lost their head intertwine in a dramatic and less dramatic way in an ordinary concrete panel apartment building.

results.title: Don't Make Waves
results.overview: New York tourist Tony Curtis falls asleep on a Southern California beach on his first night in the West and wakes up to The New Phantasmagoria--catamarans, surfers (including a dog), bodybuilders, acrobats, motorcycle chicken races, a nut fishing in the shallows . . . and Sharon Tate as a skydiver named Malibu who gives Curtis the rapture of artificial respiration when he is conked on the head by a flying surfboard.

results.title: Piano Man
results.overview: A serial killer plays a cat and mouse game with a female detective.

results.title: The Piano
results.overview: Yoon Eun, who is known as a genius pianist who learns his mother's song and learns piano from the age of three, is a congenital blind person. It is not easy for Yoon Eun to take the first steps to become a pianist.  However, there is a strong support team around the world fearful example. When I cry, I cry to be a fool, but I believe my mother is more than anyone. My body is uncomfortable, but my father is knocking the keyboard with one hand to tell the world to Yoon Eun. And to Mrs. Hunan who plays Snow White and Seven Dwarfs.

results.title: Piano Player
results.overview: The creative documentary Piano Player is a story about the piano player and musician Oscar Strock, who was a well known tango music composer in 1920s Europe. Nobody knew him – only his music was well known. The life of Strock is like a side-show of everlasting debts, long voyages and wild and unlucky love affairs that find their best interpretation through his tango music. The piano player is a man, who barely arranges his life according to the political and economic circumstances in the world. To earn money, he plays for pubs and cinema theatres in Riga, Berlin and Paris, and for lovers, he writes the most romantic tango music.

results.title: Piano Lesson
results.overview: A young man fantasizes about his female piano teacher during a lesson.

results.title: Piano Blues
results.overview: Director — and piano player — Clint Eastwood (Play Misty for Me, Bird, Unforgiven) explores his life-long passion for piano blues, using a treasure trove of rare historical footage in addition to interviews and performances by such living legends as Pinetop Perkins and Jay McShann, as well as Dave Brubeck and Marcia Ball.

results.title: Woman Without Piano
results.overview: A quietly comic look at a Madrid housewife's attempt to escape from her mundane and tedious existence. Encountering mostly impersonal bureaucracy, she has no specific plan for what she wants to do, just the fervent hope that she will find the adventure she's so desperately seeking.

results.title: Piano Mooner
results.overview: Harry is a workaholic piano tuner whose bride-to-be's brother threatens to kill him if he doesn't marry his sister. His latest job assignment involves a socialite and a pesky French maid hounding him constantly.

results.title: The Piano
results.overview: An old man relays his life story to his grandson through a moving piece of music.

results.title: Piano Mover
results.overview: A piano must be delivered by Krazy in his beat up old horse wagon to a skyscraper in the middle of a city. He struggles to set up a winch and pulley, getting caught in it, ending up on a ledge, where Kitty comes out of a window to join him to do a little singing, dancing and make trouble.

results.title: Piano Tooners
results.overview: Tom and Jerry (the human versions, not the cat and mouse) work as piano tuners. After seeing them at work and several creative ways of tuning a piano (such as removing the offending key and cutting the key itself to a shorter length), the two attend an opera singers performance. The singer passes out when the piano plays a wrong note, and Tom and Jerry are pressed into service to re-tune the piano. After pulling the offending key from the keyboard like a bad tooth, the two give the opera audience a jazz piano performance, with the now recovered opera singer joining in.

results.title: Player Piano
results.overview: Rarity is trying to move a grand piano into the band room for practice, so she gets the Diamond Boys to help her. At Pinkie Pie's suggestion, Rarity tries a keytar, and finds she likes it.
